website_summaries.verdict: A basic pail at an affordable price. If you are watching your budget, this is the best model on our shortlist.
pros: Sports a wide foot pedal and soft self-closing lid
Comes at a mid-range price and backed by a limited lifetime warranty
cons: Some testers noticed that it doesn't trap odors very well

customer_reviews.title: Pet Approved, Owner Recommended
customer_reviews.text: For pet owners living in apartments, not near the dumpster, a diaper trash can is gonna be your BFF to dispose of poo bags/litter until trash day. This thing traps the odor and ensures my apartment doesn't smell like an unkempt animal shelter. I have 2 cats and a dog so pet waste is probably more than half of my own trash and yet it persists and keeps those odors locked in. Pet approved, owner recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Mactíre

customer_reviews.title: Great for Adult Needs
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for adult depends and poise pads. This works great! The mouth was large enough for adult products, and the bags are easy to change (I change them myself, the elderly do not), and the scent keeping is as well as can be expected. There aren't many "full" diapers that enter the pail, however a halfway filled bag can leave an odor in a medium sized bathroom pretty quickly. If you need a pail the 2pk refills are economical and a fabreze plugins will benefit your piece of mind. Owned for over three months of continued use with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: AshBox

customer_reviews.title: Used for cloth and disposable diapers
customer_reviews.text: Love this diaper pail so much that I bought two- one for disposables and wipes, another for cloth diapers. We are 7 weeks in and both are holding up beautifully. I love that there is no smell from either pail, and we let ours go a lot longer than we should between changes (literally diapers piling up so the lid won't close properly). Baby is on exclusively breast milk, so we will see how these do once we move to solids. The pails looks great in the nursery, and I love that there are multiple colors to choose from. Highly recommend these for both cloth and disposable diapers!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFanatic

customer_reviews.title: This thing is wonderful! It keeps all odors in and I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be used for an adult who has many bowel and bladder issues and who has to wear disposable undergarments. This thing is wonderful! It keeps all odors in and I don't worry about my house smelling bad. It is easy to use and there is no waste of bags. I simply empty it on trash pick up days and start a new bag by cutting off and tying where the new bag needs to begin. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Terri

customer_reviews.title: Not good for poopy diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this diaper pail. It’s super easy to use and it looks like it would work great but for some reason it doesn’t trap in the odors at all. After disposing one dirty toddler diaper, his whole room and hallway stinks like I left the diaper sitting out. On the flip side, the bags are super easy to change and I love that you cut the bag so you don’t feel like you have to fill the pail before changing the bag. Even with a new bag in, the pail still holds odors from previous diapers so I feel like the room always stinks now.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Horton

customer_reviews.title: Overall, I would recommend this one over the Munchkin and Diaper Genie.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it's hands free. It seems like the roll of bags lasts longer than the Diaper Genie roll. It doesn't keep the smell out as much as I'd hoped, but a huge improvement from the Munchkin brand I had before. Overall, I would recommend this one over the Munchkin and Diaper Genie.
customer_reviews.author: Amry

customer_reviews.title: Moat convenient and affordable solution out there!
customer_reviews.text: I love this diaper trash can! First and foremost is it a hands free solution that makes your life easier when dealing with those very frequent diaper changes! The flap keeps odors out without a problem! The locking function will definitely come in handy when you have kids running around! But on too of all that you won't break the bank on the refill bags. There is name brand and generic options out there, and the bag lasts you for a while! No replacing with those plastic held cartridges that are so very wasteful. Just one very long bag that gets cut after each use until used up! I would highly recommend this product over anything else on the market!
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible diaper pail.
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold in any smell at all. It's just a small trash can with extra steps to take out the trash. Cannot put any poopy diapers in it or else the smell just emanates from it. There is literally nothing to keep the smell from escaping the this diaper pail. There is like one rubber ring, even though there are like 5 openings. Just disappointing and terrible. I should have returned it when I had the chance. Also have the ubbi diaper pail and even tho that one has other issues, it doesnt leak the smell. Definitely get what you pay for with this.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Using it as a outdoor receptacle for dog and cat waste
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved to a condo and have four senior pets; two dogs and two cats. Always bagging up cat and dog poop. I originally had a regular garbage can outside - which wasn't an issue until the weather got warm. Holy crap (lol)! The smell and the flies. I looked into "litter lockers," etc. - but this product came up in one of my searches. This thing is AMAZING! No more flies. No more smell. So easy to change it out when full of the bags of pet waste. Looks completely inconspicuous on my back porch. Can't recommend this product highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: V. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, no odor, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it so much we purchased a second one for our twin boys. We keep one in the nursery and one next to a changing station in our bedroom. I am very sensitive to smell and this diaper pail when used correctly (with the proper liner) holds in ALL odors. The liners are easy to change & the bags do not go to waste since you can change out the liner after 2 diaper changes or after 20. It is also more attractive than other options that are out there. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this diaper pail! We cloth diaper our baby and this is possibly the largest one out there. It easily holds 1.5 to 2 days of cloth diapers (about 10-12 diapers easy... 15 or so if you push them down!) It came with plastic liner roll (which lasts about 6 uses i think) which is helpful. I use a cloth pail liner which is easy to put on . Once the pail is full, the door on the side of the pail can be opened to remove the liner with the dirty diapers. It has a top flap and a secondary flap which keeps the stink in! GREAT PAIL for disposables or cloth diapers! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: For the price is amazing. I recommend 100%. Now this is not the bin for you if you dont take out your trash everyday. The smell is controlled for me cuz everyday I empty it. Diapers never get to stay long enough to smell in the room. I did not buy refill bags. I just got regular 15 gallon bags that are pretty cheap to use and it's working out perfectly. I have 2 babies, a new born and a 18 month old and this is just the right size to accommodate daily dirty Pampers. I cant tell you enough how happy I am that I got this bin!
customer_reviews.author: kandice putkoo

customer_reviews.title: Got for this Senior!
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of my small bathroom smelling. I have a pet genie, and I knew about a baby diaper genie, and so I decided to look for one for adult diapers. I read the reviews on a few of these, and someone mentioned liking this one because of the larger opening. That is perfect for me, because I can fit an adult diaper into it. I want to say that this holds about 5 to 8 adult diapers I guess before you have to change the bag. All in all I love it! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: New Mexico Lady

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: I think the advertising for this is over hyped. This does not keep smells totally out like a diaper genie does. The lock feature is flimsy and it’s also not hands free. You have to push on the opening to get the diapers in. It’s okay. Basically a glorified garbage can. If the seal was as good as the diaper genie, I’d give this a better review. You can smell what’s in the pale after a little while. Overpriced. I wouldn’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: Good at first
customer_reviews.text: It was good at first as far as containing the smell. I don't know why 4 months later it's a different story. You don't even have to open it to smell what's inside, you can smell when you're approaching the diaper pail. I used to put this inside the room right next to the changing station. Now, it needs to stay in the bathroom. Another thing is that this isn't hands-free. Even after pushing your foot on the pedal to open the lid, you still have to push the cover where the dirty diaper goes through with your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon C.

customer_reviews.title: Worse at containing smells than trashcan with lid
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that this is one of my all time most disappointing and perplexing Amazon purchases. I can't understand how this product has the rating that it does. This product fails miserably at the main thing that it is created for -- containing the odor of diapers. I have even resorted to putting baking soda boxes in the bottom of the bottom of the container, which helps somewhat, but does not change the fact that the product is fundamentally flawed. Had I not stupidly thrown out the packaging when I set this up, this product definitely would have been going back. I recommend anyone considering this product to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Donatello

customer_reviews.title: So happy with our choice
customer_reviews.text: I was debating which diaper pail to purchase for a long time, as there are so many options on the market and I'm so glad I went with this one. It's very easy to use - just step on the pedal and push the diaper through the flap (which is very easy to do). You can also just open the top part with your hand if you prefer, which is easier sometimes. The refills are so easy, so we haven't tried normal trash bags yet. I also like that it can become a normal trash rack when we're done with the diaper pail part. I have 2 in my house and am so happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Love it for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my son's cloth diapers. He is exclusively breastfeeding, so his diapers do not really smell bad. I have not noticed any odor once the diapers are placed in the can. I use PlanetWise wet bags in the can. I have two wet bags and just take out one and put another bag in. The can will hold about 1-1.5 days worth of diapers. He is four months and I change him at least once every two hours, except at night. It is great.
customer_reviews.author: azcutie

customer_reviews.title: This is not the brand to get unless you like being assaulted by stinky diaper stench
customer_reviews.text: Well. When the lid is closed there is no scent. BUT when you drop a diaper in, the foul stench that wafts up is so pervasive and lingering. So disappointed. The lock feature is handy, but also not, because instead of just dropping it in and going about your way hands free, you have to step on the pedal to open to top, reach down to knee height, turn the knob, drop in the diaper, smell the stench, turn the knob back, then let the pedal release. And sometimes the outer lid doesn’t want to close all the way. I wouldn’t buy again, and I haven’t recommended to my fellow new moms.
customer_reviews.author: Meg D.

customer_reviews.title: I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: After trying numerous diaper pail’s I decided to give this one a shot because it had really good reviews. I purchased my first one and I really liked the sleek design. I instantly purchased a second because I needed one for upstairs and downstairs. Within just a few days of only putting your urine filled diapers I began to smell a stench coming from the pails without them being opened. This was a huge bummer for me because I purchased two and because they’re already used I can’t necessarily return them. If given the chance to purchase again I wouldn’t. I don’t believe that this is any better than everything else out there
customer_reviews.author: Chanel Earley

customer_reviews.title: Great for cloth or disposable diapers.
customer_reviews.text: Great for cloth, my large wet bag just popped right in. Super easy set up, the amount of diapers it holds it’s actually quite large and I love that you don’t have to squish the diapers to get them into the pail. I also love that you can use this as a trash can when you no longer need it as a pail. Buying another for a friends baby shower!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for pee, not for poop
customer_reviews.text: This is okay for pee diapers, but not poop. The poop smell still comes through the pail which was disappointing. I prefer our diaper genie in that regard. I LOVE the lock feature though. My preschooler likes to "help" and likes to push the hatch open letting all the smells out. But since there is a lock on this one it prevents her from doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: This pail is beyond better than the Diaper Genie that we had before
customer_reviews.text: This pail is beyond better than the Diaper Genie that we had before. It fits many more diapers before it needs to be changed and features a slicer inside the pail to cut the bag. The mint green matched my daughter's room perfectly. I appreciate the child lock setting now too. Sometimes, if the diaper isn't heavy it won't open the door flap with a simple drop, but that isn't a huge deal. I find that the odor control seem comparable to the genie. Neither one is perfect, but not bad. The deodorizing pouches do seem to help.
customer_reviews.author: April McGehee Azbill

customer_reviews.title: Great for waste, not great on smell
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had a diaper genie in the past, and although we liked it just fine, so far we’re preferring this diaper pail. It seems to fit a lot more diapers and is much easier to remove the bags from. The bags also seem to last a lot longer. The lock feature is so helpful since we have a very curious toddler who likes to throw things away constantly. It’s not as great with odor containment as I hope it would be though. Nothing seeps out when it’s closed but when you go to put a diaper in, the smells escape strongly.
customer_reviews.author: Laur

customer_reviews.title: Small but does conceal odors
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this diaper pail for cloth diapers, I really did. First, this is very small for cloth diapers, fills up within 2 days with 1 child, 2 kids, forget it. I tried using the Planet Wise pail line and it's almost too thick for this pail. You have to take the white part off the can and put the liner around the inside then close the white part, then the lid. To take the liner out with a full stash of dirty diapers you have to unhook it from the top then pull it out from the bottom. It was just a lot of work. I returned mine for these reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Tobiko

customer_reviews.title: EDITED: STINKY PAIL
customer_reviews.text: Love these diaper Pails. Inherited one I had to touch to insert diaper. With these all I have to do it use foot pedal and if diaper is saturated it will fall through hole on its own. No touching necessary. Now there is a scent when the flap opens I’d there are poopy diapers in the pail. I Just try to empty it frequently. EDITED: OK It' been a few months and these pails STINK!! Crazy me got two of them!!! UGH! I've been changing regularly and putting essential oils and baking soda to help with the stink! And they're horrible. The smell seems to be in the plastic!! UGH!! Cute pail. But they start to stink!!! :(
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose.. at one point
customer_reviews.text: Does its job! Can't smell anything coming from it at all. ***Update**** I've had this diaper pail for a year and out of no where, the springs underneath the flap that pushes it down, broke off. Ive noticed the past few weeks, the pail doesn't contain the order anymore. I couldn't figure out why. I checked it over and everything looked okay. I lysoled and alcoholed, but still a smell. Tonight I noticed the lid would not go down and saw a spring popped! It's not even half full and it's not like we cram it. Totally disappointed because before these last few weeks, it really was a good pail. For that I'm taking away 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren T

customer_reviews.title: Better than a genie!
customer_reviews.text: This product holds a LOT of diapers and it’s nice that you don’t have to squeeze them in like you do with a genie. The refills are cheaper also and I love how you can cut your own bags and make them the size you need. My baby is 9 months old and so far, I only smell the diapers when I open the lid. My 2.5 year old niece came to visit and her mom put one of her dirty diapers in there and it didn’t contain the smell very well. This product might be more suited for younger babies! I’m happy with it for now though. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but also didnt wabt to apend loads of money on a trash can. Perfect size and not an eye sore. I liked having the tie off bag feature because then your not wasting bag if you o ky have a little your throwing out. Its also super easy to just use a regualr kitchen garbage bag (which were using now). We usually go about a week and i dont ever smell any dirty diapers. The lock feature is nice because my dog tries to stick her head in and try to grab one. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ardis

customer_reviews.title: Best one on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is the best one on the market. For my first kid, we used the diaper genie. Bags were expensive, had to touch the thing a lot, and it didn’t contain the smell very well. Thing one is much better. The bag refills last us about 4 months, at about $15 a pop. They are much easier to use and much cheaper than the competitors. The pail keeps the smell where it belongs, inside. I really like the foot pedal for the hands free lid. This one is by far the best one on the market.
customer_reviews.author: jlu

customer_reviews.title: Does not lock in ordor
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's just me, but this does not lock in odor. I switched from a munchkin diaper pail due to the plastic latch breaking after 6 years of use to this Dekor Plus and I'm super disappointed in the product. I don't know if it's faulty, it seems like a nice pail, but doesn't do the #1 thing I bought it for. I can't be bothered by returning it because it's a waste of my time, but I would not buy this unless you plan on tp empty the pail after every doo-doo diaper. No thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Still prefer the diaper genie but product is decent enough
customer_reviews.text: Much more attractive than a Diaper Genie, this product underperforms in disguising diaper odor. Short in stature and without foot pedal comparable to the genie, it is also not as easily used and can be full within a day whereas with the genie we were able to go a week plus without changing out. However, the liners on this product are more durable than Genie’s, and the ability to use garbage bags with it makes it cheaper to use long-term... if the product holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa S

customer_reviews.title: Self closing lid broke right away
customer_reviews.text: The one complaint I have with this product is that the top lid doesn’t shut. I use the foot pedal to open it but when I walk away the lid is still open. The self closing feature is broke and I’ve had it less then a month. Other than that I think it’s a great product. Holds lots of diapers, easy to empty and doesn’t let smell escape even with the top lid open
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper pail ever!! This brand offers biodegradable bag sleeves which is perfect since I’m using Dyper brand diapers that are made from bamboo. Save the ocean and the turtles!! The odor is very well contained and the hands free drop and go diaper disposing system is the best. Buy this for someone who’s expecting or for yourself. Buy this over the regular size. You won’t regret it. Also, you can make this into a regular trash can once your baby outgrows diapers. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: GEll

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper pail for disposables, Opening/Can too small for cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: GREAT diaper pail, especially for the price! If I was using disposables I would LOVE love it; however, I'm cloth diapering and the hole in the top is a little small to drop cloth diapers through. In addition, the pail just isn't large enough for me (doesn't quite hold 2 days worth, ~ 14-16 cloth diapers). That being said, the lock feature works great, and no stink was ever detected. I also really liked the bag inserts that came with the can, super easy/handy - and you could also use a reusable liner if desired no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylin

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper pail. Uses regular trash bags as well
customer_reviews.text: Works just as it should! I found I really like the extended bag feature, which by the way, it came with! But once it ran out, I’m able to use regular trash bags as well. Only thing, the spring action door needs some weight to open it up so my tip would be to dispose wipes and diaper all at once. Otherwise the wipes just sit there and you gotta open it with your hand. Ew. Defeats the foot pedal purpose. Anyways. Still Love this pail.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Love everything but the smell..
customer_reviews.text: As a mother of twins I spend a lot of time with this diaper pail. I love everything about it except for the fact that it releases "slap you in the face" poo odor, even when it's nearly empty. I empty it every other day for my twins. I do like the powder scent of the refills, and I purchase the biodegradable ones. It makes me feel a little bit better about the fact that I'm polluting the earth with millions of tiny, poo diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Heather E

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper pail by a mile and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: So this is my second one I bought my first one 5 years ago. Well that one had a break on the spring so the trap door would stay open. Pretty much turning it into a regular trash can. I sent them an email with a pic attached. In 4 days I had a replacement part at my front door. This thing works great for smell and ability to hold lots of diapers . There customer service is amazing as well! Don’t buy any other diaper pail you will have this one for life.
customer_reviews.author: Jasseu

customer_reviews.title: Dont believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product when our baby was born back in December 2019. At first, it seemed to work great. However, after the baby stared eating solid food, and his poopoo because smelly, it simply did not contain the odor AT ALL. I paid so much money for this and now I have to go and find something else that works because the baby's rooms smells bad. Extremely disappointed. Oh, and the door latch on the side does not stay securely closed. I simply dont have many good things to say about this product, based on our experience recently.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and effective at keeping diaper odors contained! I like the continuous bag design too, it makes taking out the trash much less of a hassle. I didn’t read the instructions and was using a pair of safety scissors to cut the bag.. Which was fine, but using the built in bag cutter makes it even quicker! Overall I really like this product, and the fact that it blends seamlessly into my nursery is just a bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel F. Stone

customer_reviews.title: As pleasant as something that holds poo can be...
customer_reviews.text: We love this diaper pail. It is very stylish and the design is great. I like the way the refill feature works, very easy to change the bag! It also holds the odors in exceptionally well...we've been using it for two weeks now and have not yet smelled a dirty diaper coming from it. Once our baby is a little bigger we will be switching to cloth diapers so will be putting a waterproof liner in it. I am hopeful that it will keep the odors out equally as well.
customer_reviews.author: JennyHeigl

customer_reviews.title: You still have to 'squish'
customer_reviews.text: There is still some 'Squish' factor to this. The diapers get near the top but you still have room for a few more but if you only have one hand available to push them down you put your hand in the push and it catches your hand and scrapes it when you try to pull your hand out. Also we are using it for a baby eating solid foods and the stink is still obvious. We keep it in the bathroom because the smell. I wouldn't say it's superior to the diaper Genie, the only perk is that you can use regular trash bags with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great Diaper Pail
customer_reviews.text: While the liners are a little different and take some getting used to, they work well to hold diapers and contain the smell. I have noticed a little lingering poop smell after several poopy diapers and the pail being close to full. I like the trap door to keep the smell contained, although sometimes it gets dirty when trying to push an overflowing diaper through it. I also look forward to being able to use the diaper pail with my wet bags for cloth diapers when I 100% make the transition. I would recommend this product as it works just as well as other name brands but a little more economic option! Love the versatility of it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered this to hold my daughter's cloth diapers. I normally use a cloth diaper bag, but for convenience and look I wanted a diaper pail. This one is really nice! I no longer smell her diapers and it holds quite a few at a time. It's sleek looking and doesn't take up much room. I got the cloth diaper liners instead of the plastic ones for a obvious reasons. It did come with a set time of plastic bags already in it. Only thing I wish it did was automatically lock. It would just easier. Great choice though!
customer_reviews.author: Jamaal S

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold scent in.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product. It does not hold the scent. My entire house smells. I had a playtex diaper genie and it actually held smells in. The design of this diaper pail is a lot better than the playtex one. however, I think the point of a diaper pail is so hold in smells and this just does not do it in the slightest you might as well just throw them in a trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: This is a great system! Took some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: This is a great system! Took some getting used to, but once I got the hang of everything, this is fabulous. My only wish is that they made a larger Dekor for adult diapers so you get more mileage out of the bags. Other than that, works really well. Tip -- I place a jar of Clear Air freshener in the bottom of the pail for further odor control, and it really works.
customer_reviews.author: M. Braunn

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail is great for containing the odor (although EBF at 3 months we don't have a dominant odor problem yet). I like that it can be used as a garbage bin after we are done with diapers. The pail itself is lightweight yet sturdy and it's easy to refill bags. The bag cutter inside the door is very useful. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper pail!
customer_reviews.text: I love this diaper pail! The refills are easy to insert and not expensive! But we haven’t even used the whole one that came with the pail in the two months we’ve had it as we’ve only had to take it out three times. The smell is well contained though I recommend putting a charcoal deodorizer in the bottom because it can be smelly when you open the bottom door to take it out. It’s very easy to change it out when the bag is full using the cutter on the door. The diaper pail also looks nice, I love that it matches the decor in the nursery.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can use your foot to open the top lid and that you don’t have to cram the diaper into a small hole. My son is only a few weeks old so the poopy diapers don’t have a strong odor yet. But honestly I only wanted I diaper pail like this mainly so my dog wouldn’t get into the diapers. He can open regular kitchen garbages with a flip lid so I needed something a little more than that. Emptying it is pretty easy. I bought the plus so it would hold more and glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend for cloth diapering
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed in this diaper pail. I hardly ever have to leave negative reviews. They market this as cloth diaper friendly. They even sale cloth diaper liners. When you cloth diaper there are parts that need to be removed so you can insert cloth bags and diapers. Soon as I did that it all fell apart. Springs popped off, the lid won’t close. I still use it so I don’t completely waste my money but I would recommend trying something else for your cloth diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Jaz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using a regular trash can with a lid for diapers for the past 18 months. We had to move the can to the garage due to the smell. I was skeptical of whether the diaper genie or comparable products would live up to their claims. This product WORKS. It is in the toddler’s room and there is no diaper smell at all. It has a locking feature so toddlers don’t throw everything away (my toddler has a growing interest in trash cans lately.) Worth the money for sure.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, but smelly.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful little diaper pail, but don't waste your time buying it. I returned after just 2 days because it does not contain the diaper odor at all. And I really mean AT ALL. I love everything else about it, the ease of changing the bag, the color, the locking lid, etc. But the smell is just intolerable. However, since this isn't through Amazon, I had to contact the company's customer service to return. They were WONDERFUL. Fantastic customer service. I would've given the diaper pail 2 stars, but because their customer service was so great, I gave it 3. I will definitely buy from them in the future if they come out with a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Casey K

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials broke after 6 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: First impression: it holds several diapers, looks decent, doesn't hold back smells efficiently. After six weeks of use the trap door broke. Seriously! We looked at what held the door in and it was the smallest wire springs. I could easily break them. Once that trap door broke the smell was intolerable! It always has a stench but when that inner door is gone it is over. Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha S.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing keeps you awake for night time feedings better than the smell of diapers!
customer_reviews.text: As much as I have loved not squishing diapers in, at least our old diaper pail didn't stink up my baby's room... We have two in diapers and the smell is just unbearable. Also changing the "bags" out must be done with a gas mask. It's that bad... I wish I could have loved this. I really do. I love everything about it except that it stinks (literally)! Hoping I can return it in spite of my toddler destroying the box...
customer_reviews.author: MarkNAmy

customer_reviews.title: Cloth Diapers at Daycare Pail
customer_reviews.text: We live in VA and cloth diaper our daughter at daycare. There are a lot of licensing requirements for cloth diapers containment, and I think this is the best pail. The price was reasonable and it has the foot pedal, locking mechanism, and smell containment required. That being said, we have to bring the diapers home every day so we don't know if it can contain a smell for more than 10 hours. I've used it with both cloth diaper bags (washable) and the Dekor refill packs. I prefer the Dekor bags since it is easier to cut a fresh bag every day and take the top off to replace a washable bag.
customer_reviews.author: AnneKris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. We use a reuseable wet bag for cloth diapers instead of the plastic and it fits perfect. (we did not buy the Dekor bag, a cheaper large wetbag works fine). Easy to clean and easy to swap out bags as well. Hides the smell fantastically. My only complaint would be, sometimes the top lid gets stuck open and we have to manually push it down. That is not really an issue because when that happens the smell is still hidden because of the other opening.
customer_reviews.author: Dru

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: It’s better than the diaper genie price wise when you consider the cost of refills. You can put a normal garbage bag in this though. However, the smell does come out regardless of what bag you use. And my daughter still managed to wedge her finger between the door when it’s locked. AND, you still have to touch the diaper when you drop it in there, and stuff it down. Unavoidable unless you want to change the bag constantly. Doesn’t hold much.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella Baehr

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good buy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Bought the pink dekor plus and it arrived within 2 days - yay! Love the pink color. Seems like a good diaper pail. Will update when I begin using. Cons: came with orange stains on the pink paint like other reviewers have warned. I will say it does not bother me enough to ask for a replacement. I cannot see the stains from far away; only when I’m standing right next to it. It’s a diaper pail so I could really care less about the orange smudging. Overall happy (so far) with my purchase. Have also purchased the dekor cloth diaper bags to use in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Functional item
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Shipped in reasonable time, looks nice, comes with disposable bags, can use small garbage bags with item after. Keeps most diaper smell contained Cons: Doesn't hold many diapers, need to change almost daily, Lid stays up and have to push back down manually, Lock on door pops open when bag is full might be pro too because you'll know to change the bag. Overall I would not, not recommend, but I'm sure there is better out there. It suites our needs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kody Robison

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to keep the dirty cloth diapers in
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I cloth diaper our youngest daughter. I bought this to keep the dirty cloth diapers in. I loved it so much I purchased another one for a friend. I wasn't sure at first if it would work. It is super easy to change the bags. I love the lock feature. My older two children will sometimes play in my youngest's room. Having the lock feature keeps their little hands out.
customer_reviews.author: Knreynolds

customer_reviews.title: Dude get it!
customer_reviews.text: Was a huge skeptic at first, argued with my wife about spending the money on a “trashcan. “ I was wrong, I would buy this thing 100 times over again. Great investment. I could have 20 pounds of diapers in this and still not smell a thing! If you’re giving your wife a hard time about spending money on this try throwing your diapers in your kitchen trashcan for a week, then try this...
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Smells up the whole room
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for one week. I was really hoping to like this product... But I'm incredibly disappointed. The second I put a new diaper in it (even if the flap only opens for a second), the whole room smells like poop. Doesn't contain the smell at all... I may as well be throwing the diapers in the trash. If I hadn't thrown out the box, I'd be requesting a return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: diaper does not enclose odor - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: first- my initial diaper pail arrived damaged with a broken lid with out any exterior box. I was sent a replacement which was not damaged. discovered after using that in fact this pail is horrible with odor control, and the purpose of it is to save time from having to bring out trash each time a soiled diaper is placed in pail yet this is not possible when the pail does not control odor.
customer_reviews.author: cherie

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: We initially purchased this diaper pail to use for dirty cloth diapers. So far, our wet bags do not fit inside this pail. We have used it for disposable diapers and it works well with plastic bag. Overall, it keeps all odors inside the pail, which is great and won't stink up the room. It also holds a lot of dirty diapers, so there is no need to take out the trash more than usual.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Yes, there is a bit of a smell on occasion. It is plastic after all. But it is really easy to use and to clean. When I take out the bag I will usually wipe down the inside with wet wipes and dry it with a paper towel. If we have a really bad diaper I will use either a doggie doodoo bag or an individual travel diaper disposal bag before tossing it in. It really helps. The pail works wonders for large diapers. I don't have to change it out as often as I have had to with our old diaper genie essentials. I would definitely recommend this diaper pail!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pail and the best customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this pail a year now and it has been great. I only have to take diapers out once a week and the smell is pretty well contained. Recently, one of my son's monster loads broke the spring trap door when I tossed it in and I sent an online request to the warranty department. I got a follow up e-mail the next morning and a replacement trap door sent to my home free in less than a week, no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Running Mom

customer_reviews.title: Clean, Easy, and Hides odors well
customer_reviews.text: I love this diaper pail! It really contains smells and changing out the dirty diaper bags is clean and easy. We fill this diaper pail about every two weeks and we have a two month old. I highly recommend this if you don’t want to take every diaper out to the trash after every diaper change which is a about 10x a day for us. No one wants to take a dirty diaper out to the trash in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: Love it and works great other trash bags besides the one provided. I love it and it worked great the first 3 months. I dont smell it or anything it's just the bottom door keeps opening after it starts getting used and I have to keep trying to lock it but it opens and wknt latch. I have to tape it in order for it to be closed. So the locking mechanism to remove the trash bag is terrible. Otherwise it is good for use and I love the color and how it looks nice and not like other diaper pails.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Leon

customer_reviews.title: Door doesn’t stay shut but otherwise great trashcan.
customer_reviews.text: I love this trashcan. The only problem I have with it is that the door to grab the trash out of has never closed. I’ve had it taped up since day one of it arriving. Top lock works great, it’s just the door that swings open even when there’s no dirty diapers inside of it. I’m hoping it’s just a misalignment malfunction on mine and not all. Too bad, would have liked to purchase a second one of these as it DOES do the job it’s meant to do and I do like it otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary & Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Love this diaper pail
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this diaper pail, so happy I went with this one. Although my breastfed baby rarely has a stinky poop, it really contains odors from what I can tell. Definitely worth the money, especially when you compare to others. I love that you don't have to buy special bags for it like other pails. You can use the bags made for it, or you can use any kind of garbage bag you like. Really great diaper pail, looks cute too.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. No problems.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 8 months now. I love it. Started using it when my child was a newborn and have another child who is 2.5 and not yet trained. I use this for both of them and change it every Saturday. The smell gets stronger on Thursday but not to a degree where I would be embarrassed in front of my mother or mother in law. I do use the dekor bags. I really love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher K.

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT contain odor at all!!
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY good thing about this is the drop door as opposed to having to push a diaper in like the Genie. But if you have a poop diaper, or it's been a couple days since it's been changed, as soon as you open the TOP lid, it stinks. And even when closed, there's an odor that seeps out. I'm having to empty it when the bag isn't even half full. I didn't get a diaper pail so I could change it every day. that's what my regular trash can was for. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this pail
customer_reviews.text: Love this pail! I spent a lot of time researching before deciding on this one to use with cloth diapers. We initially used the disposable liners that came with it until we used them all, and then we switched to a Planet Wise reusable pail liner which fits perfectly. After 2-3 days, the diapers inside smell HORRENDOUS, but this thing keeps all that stink inside! You absolutely cannot smell anything until you open it. I also love that the lid has a locking mechanism because my 3 year old is constantly trying to stick her hands in it.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do anything except collect diapers
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this based on promise of odor control and locking ability stated in the product description. Odor control is non-existent. The top 'locks' but the front won't stay shut so what's the point? Really disappointed in this product and it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Doing without

customer_reviews.title: Best Diaper Pail EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This diaper pail is sooo much better than a Diaper Genie and it's so much cheaper! The opening where you drop in the diaper is bigger, so there's no having to push down a diaper. There's no wasting excess bags and the attached scissor-like device cuts through the bags so easily. No smell emits from it.. I mean, this pails is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: KATHY TOLBERT

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great Until It Didn't
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for a few months until one of hinges on the interior flap broke and I couldn't get a replacement for it. Now I'm stuck with an expensive diaper pail that doesn't work the way it's supposed to and refills for it because it's passed the time when I can return them.
customer_reviews.author: The Rented Nest

customer_reviews.title: Alternate use
customer_reviews.text: There isn’t a diaper in sight, so the Dekor Plus isn’t being used quite as intended, but it’s provided a perfect solution for disposing of incontinence pads. So instead of Pampers it handles Poise pads perfectly. No more excessive emptying of the waste basket in the designated bathroom, no more need for smelly perfume cover-ups. The bathroom stays clean, organized, and fresh smelling. Dekor was a great solution to an annoying problem! No need to be concerned about buying refills for the Dekor either. Tall kitchen bags work great.
customer_reviews.author: Cici-online

customer_reviews.title: YES.
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME. I don't typically write reviews, but after two diaper genies and into the first year of our second baby, got this pail because I liked the color options and would try anything other than another diaper genie because ours kept malfunctioning/breaking . . . Dekor holds SO many more diapers, is super easy to empty and blends into our nursery seamlessly. Not going to say it never smells, but manageable odor (we use the carbon pouches). I cannot recommend it enough. What a weird thing to get on Amazon to write a review on a diaper pail, but I am telling you . . .
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: This is our second one, we like it a lot!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my mother to keep in her house because she watches our kids. She is currently handling 3 different kids diapers, so we thought we'd upgrade her from her tiny bathroom pail to something that could handle the stink better. I like that this can take the special inserts OR a regular garbage bag! Keeps the smell in and holds a lot of diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Joss Edwards

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: I bought reusable wet bags that fit it and have been using it with cloth diapers. It keeps the smell in really well. My in-laws also have one that they bought for when their first grandbaby was born and it has mostly had disposables in that one. I'm use to cloth diapers and cloth just doesn't smell as strongly as disposables do to me so I noticed how well it worked more with the disposables when I was visiting.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Not very impressed- it still smells.
customer_reviews.text: Functionally and usability-wise this diaper pail is fine, but it still smells every time you put something in. The double trap door does an ok job containing the smell while it sits, but as soon as you add another diaper, both doors are open at the same time (even just for a split second) and the room smells. I’ve only had it a week.
customer_reviews.author: E. Engel

customer_reviews.title: No smell after husband ignored the full pail for 4 weeks while I was away
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim now that we have 2 kids. A real diaper pail seemed needed now that we’ve got double the amount of diapers. I went on a 4 week vacation with the kids. My husband stayed home (spoiler alert he didn’t clean one thing. But this is not the place) Long story short. The diaper pail still contained all dirty diapers from 2 kids. Getting nastier and nastier for 4 weeks. I couldn’t smell a thing. 10/10 would always recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Elendil

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love. Love the fact that it locks. Our little one isn't walking yet but this feature will be very handy once that happens. It really keeps the smell out. I can smell the yucky diapers after I have thrown one in there but once it's closed, the smell is gone. I LOVE the fact that there is a was of cutting the bag inside instead of having to toate sissors and cut the bag. Really quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: The flap on the top opens easily with any diaper load
customer_reviews.text: This works exceptionally well. The flap on the top opens easily with any diaper load. The flap always closes and the smell is nicely contained within the pail. Swapping out the bag when it's full is easy and mess free. The only improvement I can think of would be to add an indicator for when the space is full in the bin. Usually this takes a week to fill up for us.
customer_reviews.author: Anna T.

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper pail!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best diaper pail !!! I love how big it is ,easy to use and no smell in our nursery. Nice modern design. I like that you can have a choice what size ( model) to pick. I thought that the bag system woud be complicated to use but it is so easy and fun and I think if somebody really don’t want to buy special bags you ca use just regular trash bags the only problem will be to remove the bag without making whole room smell. Plus after you done with diapers you can use it as regular trashcan somewhere
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and handsfree... But I still smell nasty diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this diaper pail really is hands free. I can just step on the lever on the bottom and the lid will quietly lift up. Then I can just drop the diaper in, take my foot off, and it'll shut quietly instead of slamming like my old diaper pail did. As for odor elimination, it kinda sucks. It's not even full yet and all I smell when I walk in the room is smelly diapers! Time to plug in my Scentsy.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money; especially for cloth or smelly diapers.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these pails. I got a second one for our cloth diapers; one for dirty, one for wet, so I can just pre-rinse the dirty ones before adding the rest and washing them all. Easy installation, I like that it comes with disposable liners for if you do disposable diapers. Easy to switch out reusable cloth bags as well. Seems to run smoothly, click in place, and most importantly, keep our room from smelling like (as my husband says) "a litter box."
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about ordering any kind of diaper genie because they were getting such bad reviews. This one got fairly good reviews and it’s well deserved. I love the color and functionality. Has a trap door for odor. After using the foot pedal..it has a delayed door that closes which makes it nice so it doesn’t slam shut.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Works for cloth diapers and disposable diapers
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these diaper pails we’ve owned. The first one we used for my son many years ago, and we re-purchase it since having my daughter. I love this diaper pail because it allows you to use either disposable diapers or cloth diapers. We use both. It locks the way the scent, and it’s aesthetically pleasing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Step and drop
customer_reviews.text: We use this with cloth bags for cloth diapers. It does not hold as many pocket diapers as I would like. It holds about a day and half worth for a 1 month old. I wish I could fit a full 2 days worth. But it is nice to step and drop. We haven’t had to use the locking feature. Bags are easy to change. Contains smells.
customer_reviews.author: SmalltownMomma

customer_reviews.title: So Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this diaper pail. It contains the odor well. Some odor does escape when you drop a diaper in, but doesnt last long. I do put some odor absorbing kitty litter in the bag with the diapers and there is a sock containing litter in the bottom of the pail. I havent tried it without, so I dont know how the pail is without.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until it broke at one year
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Dekor pail that we've owned. The product works well until....it doesn't. We replaced our first pail after 2 years because it stopped containing the stink. This pail BROKE at one year. The lid springs broke to be permanently open and the inner ring that holds the liners came loose and there's no way to fix it. The concept is great as it's hands free. The parts just don't stand up to the repetitive use required from many diaper changes each day.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn

customer_reviews.title: Great odor sealing diaper pail!
customer_reviews.text: This diaper can is fantastic! A thousand times better than the nasty diaper genie I had before. This can really hides odors- we empty it once a week or so and there are no odors in between. It's so easy to use. I love the foot pedal to open it and the trap door diapers drop through, so it really is hands free. My only complaint is that I wish it was a little bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Heather cheek

customer_reviews.title: No, just no
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this as I nurse my 1 month old at 4am worried to death I might suffocate and die from the wretched smell. This diaper pail is terrible, it does not trap in any odors. I have a fear of our house smelling like dirty diapers and me not recognizing it smells. Well this does a good job letting me know it fails. Also, the door to access the used diapers does not stay closed. That’s probably a reason the smell isn’t contained very well. I started having to tape it closed with gorilla glue take. Will be packing this away in the morning to send back. *I have no clue how this has good reviews*
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It does keep the smells in pretty well and I love that it has a little knob to lock the inner flap--my son loves to try to play with the flap and it keeps him from touching or pulling out all the dirty diapers. The trashbag system is easy to use and replace. It does fill up quickly if you're using cloth diapers (I've used both with it), but from what I understand, this is one the bigger side of most diaper pails and the flap is plenty big enough to fit either kind. It's also pretty easy on the eyes overall. Simple, but nice.
customer_reviews.author: whistlebird

customer_reviews.title: Works well and with normal trash bags.
customer_reviews.text: This product works well, we have been using it for about 2 months now, it keeps the smell of dirty diapers confined to around the can and wafts a little bit when you drop a diaper in it but that's to be expected. Change the bag frequently like you really should anyway and the smell is no issue. Easy to use while one hand is full with baby and the other is trying ti dispose of the dirty diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL.
customer_reviews.text: A LOT nicer than the Diaper Genie, a lot cheaper then the Genie, and a lot more easy to use. You don't have to use specific refills, you can use regular garbage bags if you would prefer. We got the grey one and it looks really nice. I love the locking mechanism! This is the best diaper pail on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper pal ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: When i was completing my registry many told me not to buy a diaper gene because it will smell. A friend recommended this diaper pal therefore i added it to the registry. I was not disappointed. So far, I have bor smelled any dirty diaper and it is soooo easy to change bags. I highly recommend this product 👌
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Our baby was about 15 months old and we’d been using the same Diaper Geenie since day 1. No amount of cleaning was going to help so we finally tossed it. After reading reviews this looked great and could be used as a trash can after potty training. But, this just really does nothing to mask the smell of poopy diapers. I know it’s a lot to ask, but our DG was so much better at that than this one is. So we don’t put any poop diapers in it at all. On the plus side - it looks nice, is durable, and has a locking mechanism that could be helpful with some toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more genies.
customer_reviews.text: This frickin thing is so much better than a traditional diaper genie. If you’re currently using a genie, toss that thing and order the Dekor plus. No more squishing your hand into stuck diapers, no more gagging smells of days old diapers once you break the seal, easier to drop in diapers, hoods more, absolutely no stink...it’s a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: DadBodforLife

product_meta.title: Dekor Plus Hands-Free Diaper Pail | Gray | Easiest to Use | Just Step – Drop – Done | Doesn’t Absorb Odors | 20 Second Bag Change | Most Economical Refill System |Great for Cloth Diapers
product_meta.description: Color:GrayWho’s excited about changing diapers 6,000-9,000 times per child? Dekor Hands-Free Diaper Pails are designed to make this unpleasant chore as easy as possible for you AND your budget. Unlike other disposal systems where you have to bend over, operate a lid, or shove a soiled diaper halfway inside the can, Dekor pails are 100% hands-free. After a diaper change, you are likely to have baby in one arm and the soiled diaper in the other. No one has a third hand to operate the diaper pail. Just STEP on our foot pedal AND DROP the soiled diaper through the trap door. No squishing, twisting or cramming. No other diaper pail on the market is as easy to use! A childproof lock keeps curious toddlers out. Continuous liners allow you to empty the pail whenever you want, using only as much refill as you need. Simply cut the refill with the kid-safe cutter located inside the access door, discard, and tie a new knot in the remaining bag. You don’t need to waste a full bag to empty a partially-full pail. There is an effective triple odor control that keeps smell in the pail. First, the spring-loaded trap door shuts immediately after the diaper passes through. Next, rubber gaskets on the trap door and the top lid tightly seal odors inside the pail. Finally, the refillable liner helps neutralize odors with a pleasing baby-powder scent. Because all our pails are made with closed-cell ABS plastic, they cannot absorb odors like cheaper plastics, will not dent, and are scratch- and fade-resistant. You’ll be able to use our product long after your little one is out of diapers. Simply pop out the diaper insert and use in the bathroom, kitchen, or garage. Great for use with cloth diapers with the Dekor Cloth Diaper Liner. The Dekor Plus holds up to 60 newborn diapers; and is available in the following colors: White, Gray, Pink, Blue, Black, Soft Mint.
feature_bullets: Totally Hands-Free: Step, Drop, Done! No Bending, No Twisting, No Squishing, Unlike Ordinary Pails!
Most Cost-Effective Diaper Pail Refill System on the Market. Dekor Refill System Creates Less Waste - Use ONLY What You Need!
Effective Triple Odor Control Keeps the Smell in the Pail
Award Winning Product Tested by Millions of Parents
Closed-Cell ABS Plastic Works Like Metal but Won't Rust
Use Only Genuine Dekor Refills with Exclusive End-of-Liner Marking
Comes Completely Assembled with One Full-Sized (not a starter!) Refill Pre-Installed!
Life After Diapers: Converts from Diaper Pail to Trash Can

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,073 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
